channel.title: Timeline of the City's History: 1929 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930
channel.description: Recent content in Timeline of the City's History: 1929 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930

item.title: South Water Market
item.description: When South Water Street was made over into Wacker Drive there was a wholesale exodus of the scores of commission houses. This shows the new home of the South Water Market between Fourteenth Place and Fifteenth Street from Morgan Street to Racine Avenue. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: State Street
item.description: A view from State Street looking north from Madison Street on an afternoon in 1929. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year
